{"blocks":[{"key":"1hrgb","text":"E. coli Famp Morning Culture: Add   E. coli Overnight Culture to fresh    sterile Tryptic Soy Broth (3%) in a 250 or 500 mL flask. Incubate    . to exponential phase.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":28}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":34,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":71,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":140,"length":1},{"key":3,"offset":143,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9tbln","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":4,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fn1nb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8ghr3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"0.75","error":false,"guid":"427C1EE0DDC111EC9DC59380CD604ECB","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"100","error":false,"guid":"4DA37F70DDC111EC9DC59380CD604ECB","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"2":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":9000,"guid":"5FFE7BB0DDC211EC9DC59380CD604ECB","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"3":{"type":"shaker","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":0,"error_shaker":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"CFF456FBDDC111ECB8730A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"shaker":false,"temperature":false},"shaker":"180","start":null,"temperature":"37","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":33}},"4":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"bsq87","text":"Remove Morning Culture after the incubation period elapses and leave flask at room temperature. Use host cells within 4-6 hours.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d8eva","text":"Prepare Soft Tryptic Soy Agar: Prepare fresh agar on the morning of the plaque assay. Add 30 g/L Tryptic Soy Broth and 7.5 g/L Bacto Agar to distilled water. Mix vigorously. Sterilize in autoclave at    . Remove molten agar from autoclave and place in   water bath.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":29}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":200,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":202,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":252,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"22jqt","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"83pog","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"t89l","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"3D47C3B0DDC211EC9DC59380CD604ECB","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"121","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":2700,"guid":"753FEB80DDC211EC9DC59380CD604ECB","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"2":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"A58E2440DDC311EC9DC59380CD604ECB","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"48.5","unit":10}},"3":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"bkhc3","text":"Agar must be cooled before adding host cells to prevent thermal inactivation when adding cells to the molten agar.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6si8c","text":"Sterilize: Autoclave pipet tips and growth media at least two days before the plaque assay.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"anc3i","text":"Sample Preparation: Prepare MS2 samples by ten-fold serial dilution in micro-centrifuge tubes with    1X PBS. Vortex samples between dilutions.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":18}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":99,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2m22l","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"900","error":false,"guid":"D0D51230DDFA11EC9DC59380CD604ECB","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"jkqg","text":"Spot Plating Assay: After MS2 samples are diluted, prepare agar plates (10-15 mL) per plate to be used for spot plating.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":20}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7unen","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bh0tp","text":"First, prepare negative control plates containing only agar (no host cells).","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cfltk","text":"Add   of host cells per   agar. Mix gently.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":4,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":24,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1bt5n","text":"Add 10-15 mL of molten agar to bottom of Petri dish. Swirl to spread agar evenly across the bottom of the dish. Dry for 5-10 minutes or until the agar is solidified.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eg6cb","text":"Label bottom of Petri dishes with sample information and draw grids for applying spots.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"671ok","text":"Spot MS2 samples onto the surface of the agar without touching the agar with the pipet tip. Apply the spots in labeled areas to keep track of sample information. Spot volumes can be anywhere from   to  . Incubate plates for   to   at  .","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":196,"length":1},{"key":3,"offset":201,"length":1},{"key":4,"offset":224,"length":1},{"key":5,"offset":229,"length":1},{"key":6,"offset":234,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6thvt","text":"Remove plates from incubator and count plaque forming units (PFU) per spot for each sample and dilution. Record plaque forming units, dilution, sample identification, spot replicates, and spot volume. ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ecj0b","text":"Calculate PFU/mL for each sample by aggregating total PFU across dilutions and accounting for the total undiluted volume: ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dvnaq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aa4g","text":"PFU/mL = (Total PFU across dilutions) / (Total Undiluted Volume of Sample across dilutions).","type":"align-center","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fuspk","text":" Provide enough spacing between spots to avoid spots running. Avoid moving plates before spots dry. Smaller volume spots dry faster than larger volume spots.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"8":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":1,"offset":43}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"2glg5","text":"WaterTEAM: Spot 10 technical replicates of   spots per dilution.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"b9p42","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{"0":{"data":{"amount":"10","error":false,"guid":"01A4EC20DDFE11EC9DC59380CD604ECB","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1},"mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"amount"}}}},"9":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":12,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"7b593","text":"Pour Plating: As an alternative plating method, aliquot agar with host (e.g. in sterile culture tubes or centrifuge tubes) and add MS2 sample (record volume), swirl the tube gently in-between palms, and pour into the bottom of a 100 mm Petri dish. Swirl gently to evenly cover the bottom of the dish and dry completely.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}
